Topic.Title: Chance of a Chipotle-style stock collapse after earnings--62.543%

Message.Msg: With a 3500 PE ratio? They can't squeeze me because I'm not short. I'm in put spreads. I never panic. I pay a small fee every month to rollover the spreads, and will collect when the big plunge happens like I did with Chipotle. If I were short, i would sell puts against the short position to collect the premiums. Maybe even sell put spreads (e.g.short a higher strike and long a lower strike--collect a premium yet still have the lower strike plus the short when the stock plunges).

Topic.Title: I am not sure if I still want to be SHORT AMZN into Earnings

Message.Msg: What's the correlation? IBM is a competitor and computer company, ISRG is in surgical sales, and google sells adds. All those companies have a gm% of 20 or higher, where as AMZN can barely turn a profit. AMZN is trading at an average of twice the price to book value than these comps, and their P/E is 3,000 x earnings. You're telling me I should be long? Crazy!

But if your looking for some quick coin waiting for AMZN to roll over look at DDD. Got a tiny bit at 71 today better short than CRM in the short term. - PJ
